name: Greek Style Shrimp Scampi and Linguini
headline: Greek Style Shrimp Scampi and Linguini
keywords: European Recipes,Greek Recipes,Pasta Recipes,Shellfish Recipes,Olive Recipes,Shrimp,Feta,Main Dish,Lunch
recipeIngredient: 1 pound medium to large shrimp deveined and peeled, tails removed

recipeInstructions.text: Place a large pot of water on the stove to boil. Salt water and cook pasta to al dente.
Season the shrimp with salt and pepper.

While the pasta water comes to a boil, heat extra-virgin olive oil in a deep skillet with garlic. When garlic is brown, remove and reserve. Add shrimp and cook 3 to 4 minutes. Add red pepper flakes, lemon zest, oregano, olives, and wine and cook together a couple of minutes more. Remove from heat. Add a ladle of starchy pasta cooking water to sauce and some lemon juice. Remove the sauce from the heat. Drain pasta and add to the skillet. Let pasta soak in juices for a minute then toss with parsley and feta. Use tongs to pull pasta from skillet, giving it a turn to twist in as many ingredients as possible. Then, use the tongs to remove and arrange the shrimp and ingredients that may remain in the pan, distributing them evenly among the portions.

review.reviewBody: Very easy recipe once prep was done.  I used a penne pasta and liked the way the sauce coated the penne.
The recipes and how to prepare them is simplicity in itself.  I have become an even more better cook than before.  Thank you to all the Food network chefs.  Awesome job
Delicious! We added capers for a little extra saltiness. Our grocery store has an olive bar, where you can buy what you need. We'll be making this again and again!

One added note to my previous review...Greek olives are fairly expensive but Costco sells a giant jar of PITTED Parthenon Kalamata olives for around 6 dollars--the weight is roughly 56 ounces which is just under 5 pounds compared to a standard 16 ounce jar of Mezzetta olives for around five bucks in the super markets. .

Granted,t''ll take you forever to use up these olives but for the most part, Costco's jar of olives is a steal. Just passing on a tip to my fellow cooks!

Pretty bland tasting, Had to spice it up to add flavor.  This is after using all the ingredients. Sorry, didn't keep track of additional ingredients.  Love to cook by taste.  We love greek dishes so thought this would really be wonderful.  Used only fresh herbs from our garden as well.
Love, love, love this recipe...  Super easy to make & even the kids like it!

One of the best pasta dishes I have ever made!!  I added some fresh diced tomatoes at the end with the parsley and feta and it was great!  I also used dried oregano (didn't have fresh on hand and it was still just as wonderful as ever!!!

First off let me say I am 5 months pregnant and i am really picky right now of what I eat; well I LOVED this recipe!!!! I made it exactly how it says and it turned out FANTASTIC!!! The noodles were so good and so full of flavor, which let me face it mine never are; but i will be making this again and again...

This was really easy and very tasty. I did add some mushrooms and spinach to add more veggies and substance and it was WONDERFUL. It's the first time I've been able to get a truly lemony tasting sauce with just a little kick (the red pepper flakes). We were amazed how the feta added just the right amount of flavor an saltiness with out being a melted mess like a lot of cheeses. Very yummy!! A Keeper!!!

This was delicious and so easy. My boyfriend said it tasted like something he would order in a restaurant. The only changes I made was I added some scallops in with the shrimp because they were taking up space in my freezer, added 2 tbsp butter from a leftover stick, and used fat- free feta cheese. I think next time I would add in diced tomatoes or maybe some baby spinach, just for variety and texture.
My wife and I loved.Will make again.
this was really good, I added chopped green onions to it. simered tem in with the garlic which really added to the flavor.
easy and excellent as it
Very tasty. A definite keeper.

I made this for the first time tonight and, while we were happy overall with the flavors, we are considering adding a bit more olive then the handful Rachel says and some more garlic. I'm going to play with it and see how to improve it, but the foundation of the dish is solid so it is worth experimenting.

I cook dinner every night, and rarely make things twice, but I have made this one three times!  It is just so different, and the taste is so crave-worthy, that I try to now think when I can make it without over doing it!  Make sure you use fresh parsley-- I made it with dry, and the flavor didn't show up at all in the meal.  I also used whole wheat spaghetti.  I served it with her egg soup and pita chips. So good!!!

I enjoyed this dish very much.  I followed the recipe except for adding a tin of anchovies and 2 TBL butter to the EVOOwith the rest ot the ingredients.  I ate the dish sans the garlic having forgotten about it.  Then I realized that the reserved garlic wasn't even mentioned again.  Regardless, this was a delicious dish.

This i so different from most dishes I've ever made...It is so good...The combinations of flavor (including the olives makes this a real winner. Even my "meat and potato loving" husband loves this dish. My little grandsons love this stuff. Think I've prepared 5 times in the last 3 months...
(you don't want to wear a good thing out

Another hit from Rachael!  This was a simply  delicious shrimp scampi version that I will definitely make again!  I omitted the olives since hubby doesn't like them, but it was still great.  I will make much more next time for leftovers!  The lemony flavor makes it a great supper for the summertime.
i loved the feta cheese, but i thought it was lacking flavor. i probably won't be cooking this again.

What a great recipe for my daughter's bday dinner.  The flavor was terrific and it was so easy to make.  We added some pine nuts and mushrooms  which made it superb.  A side salad of baby spinach, red lettuce, red peppers, tomatoes, artichoke hearts and red onions was a perfect.

Ii caught this episode yesterday and since I had everything on hand, made it for dinner last night.  I didn't change a thing.  Creating the garlic crisps first and squeezing the lemon in at the end, really made the dish.

After having the leftovers cold the next day I am making it again as a cold salad for a pot luck. I can't believe how well it retained its freshness and didn't turn mushy..

Note to Joy in Lubbock - you must have rated the wrong recipe -no tomatoes in this one!
This is my boyfriend's favorite dish. Love the kick of the lemon and red pepper flakes!

It says feeds 4 but must be 4 starving people because it really made a lot. The leftovers were really good the next day as a cold pasta salad. Has the advantage that all the ingredients can be assembled & then it can be cooked at the last minute if having guests.
I love this recipe! I make it all the time and  my friends always rave about it.  For a time saver use frozen precooked shrimp. I make this in less then 15 min.
This is one of the best recipes ever! I've got teenage boys that ASK for this! Packed with flavor. I find myself going back to this over and over to make. Thanx Rach!
This is an awesome recipe.. Very easy, extremly flavorful and a big hit at our house... thanks Rachael
This recipe is just great. I love it. Good job Rachel.

My husband made this recipe tonight and it was out of this world. The flavors just blended together so well. Our guests couldn't stop raving about it. Can't wait to share recipe with my friends and the chef at work. Thanks Rachel!!

This is an excellent recipe.  We made it with grilled chicken and halved the portion size since there is only two of us.  We didn't wast money by buying the expensive specific canned tomatoes Rachel mentions.  We bought 2 smaller cans of Italian whole tomatoes which was just as good.  When Rachel says this is a 30 minute meal, she means it.  Be sure not to skimp on the marscapone cheese.  It truly makes the recipe.  Yum!  Thanks Rachel!
I just made this recipe tonight and I must say it is delicious! I love it!!

This is my favorite recipe for shrimp scampi, except I usually omit the olives, feta and oregano. Many scampi recipes are heavy because they call for butter, but this one is light with a zing (from the lemon zest.) Perfect for a summer dinner.

THIS WAS AWSOME!!!!!!!! I have never written a review before, but felt I really needed to with this recipe. It was simple to prepare, and tasted DELICIOUS! My husband and kids loved it! My new favorite shrimp recipe!
I make this all the time for me and my boyfriend.  I always make extra because the leftovers are amazing!!!

This recipe was super fast to prepare and quite delicious.  Next time I would add a little butter to the EVOO when browning the garlic, and I'd add a few extra garlic cloves for a bigger flavor punch.  I added the browned garlic bits back into the finished dish which was a nice touch.  "Delish."

My husband and I made this for dinner last night.  We used about 5 oz fettuccine and 11 oz of shrimp, we minced the garlic and used dried oregano. We ate every bit--the flavor from the fresh lemon zest and juice and the feta cheese is perfect.  We had fresh asparagus with it.  Perfect meal!
Followed recipe except I omitted oregano as I didn't have & added more lemon juice.  Great taste combinations. Would be a great dish for guests.

I made this for my parents' visit, and they LOVED it! It was so easy and quick. The olives and feta gave it a nice Greek touch. Leftovers are great, too. The one change I made--I didn't use all of the recommended olive oil (I never do in a Rachael recipe). I only used a tablespoon, and it was fine.
I tooked this on valentine's day for my husband and it was a hit!! I recommend this dish to ppl on the go as well. I was able to go for my daily job at 6pm and dinner was on the table by 7:30.

This dish is Yummo! as Racheal would say.  We make this about once a month.  My kids love it.  I have made it with out the wine and it is just as good. Thanks Racheal for a great and EASY shrimp scampi dish!
Excellent......and sooooo easy!! I have to have all my ingredients ready before I start it, though......moves very quickly! Also great with capers substituted for olives and parm/reg for feta.

I made this dish as part of a buffet dinner i made for friends.  I used Penne pasta, and it turned out amazing.  everyone went home with the receipe.  the only other change i made was to use only 1/2 cup of feta cheese, and more olives.  It looked great, smelled great and tasted great!  Thanks RACHEL!!!
This is a very light dish, very quick and has several flavourful ingredients. Made extra for left overs =)

Variations I used: Added olives last to limit there flavoring to the dish. Also used 1.5 lbs of shrimp.
I used dried herbs. Very good dish and will make again. Next time I will add a little truffle oil and use the fresh herbs.

This was good, but at first, I thought it was just average, and I probably wouldn't make it again...until I tasted the leftovers that had remained in the saucepan on the stove while we had dinner.  They were much more flavorful, and I imagine that tomorrow, they will be even better!  I used regular black olives instead of the Kalamata olives, and they were not at all overpowering.  I didn't have any flat leaf parsley on hand, so I used dried, but I bet it would've been even better with fresh.  It's definitely different, but I for one enjoyed the change.
Super easy to make, and very delicious.   Even my "meat and potatoes" husband loved it.  Very good!

I made it last night for dinner.
It was great. I would definately make it again. It was very fast & easy.
Next time I make it I might add some either extra shrimp or some scallops.
I prepared the dish exactly as R.R. said.  It was so easy to do and absolutely tasted out-of-this world!!
this recipe was good but wait until the last minute to add the olives or else the whole dish will taste like olives.
Great Greek dish. Love how easy it is to make and how quick it all goes together. Yummy!!!
It was the easiest seafood recipe I have ever done. We had company that night and I made grilled asparagus and Romaine salad. Everyone talked about it all night.

I omitted the olives and feta and added 2 tablespoons of chopped cilantro just before serving.  I know this changes the recipe, but it really worked!  It is a great scampi recipe.  Very easy and tasty.
This was better the next day, cold, like a pasta salad.

My husband and I both don't like olives so I decided to substitute them with halved cherry tomatoes.
It got great reviews from my husband.
Loved it, loved it.  Full of flavor and great cold too.  Serves more than 4
This was pretty easy to make and even though my boyfriend is not a huge fan of seafood, he loved it!
I loved this dish--with the first bite, I couldn't believe that I--a noncook all my life--made something I'd not only order at a restaurant, but would come back on purpose for and order again. Bravo!

This was great!  I accidentally cooked the garlic a wee bit too long, and you could taste the bitterness, so stay clear of that!  Also, I found that adding the olives in early gave the sauce a very strong olive taste, so if you don't want that, add them in last.
It was delicious and did hint at a Greek flavor. I added capers to give it an extra kick & made it DELICIOUS!
This recipe was very easy and tasted very good, although a little bland.  Instead of feta I used parmesan cheese and didn't include olives.
I fixed this dish today, Boy!!  So good, I doubled it of corse.  Great!! Everyone thought I ordered it.  I ask Where do you get this dish here??
